column4: hello. since trevinho's repository screwed up my "wpasupplicant" package, i cannot install nor do anything with apt-get. Can anyone help me fixing this problem please?
first reset your sources.list to a sane condition, then 'sudo apt-get update' for a start
stetf they are in a sane condition already
ok, can you run 'sudo apt-get -f install' succesfully?
it tellsme "E: tha package wpasupplicant needs to be resinstalled, but cannot finda file for it.
oh sorry i copied it here
it still tells me the same.. it needs to be reinstalled but cannot find..
i tried to download a .deb package containing the package, and it does not let me install it
then you 've got to read about dpkg's --force options
